channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: The Paris prosecutor says two new suspects have been handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum.
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Corbet, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Aid efforts struggle to bring relief to parts of hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: Rescuers and aid workers have spread across Jamaica to deliver food and water after Hurricane Melissa ravaged the island.
item.dc:creator: John Myers, Jr., Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Rubio, Vance see growing speculation over their 2028 ambitions
item.description: President Trump floating Vice President Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio as a potential presidential ticket is fueling questions about their working relationship and political futures as chatter about who will lead the 2028 Republican ticket intensifies.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, The Hill

item.title: Israel says remains of three people handed over by Hamas do not match any deceased hostages
item.description: Israel's forensic testing reveals that remains of three people returned by Hamas don't match any of the deceased hostages from the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Pentagon says Ukraine can have Tomahawk missiles: Report
item.description: The Pentagon has given approval to the White House to send long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine, potentially fulfilling President Volodymyr Zelensky's desire for more weapons in his country's war with Russia if President Trump provides the final green light, CNN reported Friday.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, The Hill

item.title: Andrew, the civilian formerly known as 'prince,' faces an uncertain future
item.description: LONDON (AP) — He has lost his title as prince, lost his rent-free mansion on the sprawling grounds next to Windsor Castle and lost whatever remained of his reputation in the public eye.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Yemen will put captured UN staff on trial
item.description: Yemen says UN workers helped Israel with airstrikes, and will put UN employees on trial. 36 UN staffers were arrested in Yemen.
item.dc:creator: Abdulrhman Al-Ansi and Khaled Abdullah, NewsNation

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: LONDON (AP) — King Charles III on Thursday stripped his disgraced brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicted him from his royal residence after weeks of pressure to act over his relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Buckingham Palace said.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY and JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Over 100 killed in Brazil’s deadliest police raid as Rio authorities battle drug gangs in favelas
item.description: Brazil’s deadliest police raid left 132 dead in Rio de Janeiro as officers clashed with gangs using drones and explosives in the city’s favelas.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: King Charles strips Andrew of 'prince' title, evicts him
item.description: The royal family has been under pressure from the public to strip Andrew of his titles because of his association with Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WGN 9

item.title: Trump has 'leverage' to stop Sudan killings as satellite images reveal mass deaths: Yale researchers
item.description: Yale researchers document evidence of atrocities in Sudan's El Fasher using satellite imagery, while U.S. intelligence confirms UAE weapons transfers to the Rapid Support Forces.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: Antisemitic attacker faced 30-year sentence, gets less than 1½ years in plea deal
item.description: Tarek Bazrouk, a 20-year-old Palestinian American, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for federal hate crimes after attacking Jewish protesters in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 80-year-old Australian woman dies on island after cruise ship leaves without her
item.description: An 80-year-old Australian woman was found dead after the Coral Adventurer cruise ship allegedly left her behind on Lizard Island during a hiking tour.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Putin hails successful test of nuclear-powered underwater torpedo
item.description: Putin announced successful Poseidon nuclear drone testing as President Donald Trump urged Russia to end the Ukraine war instead of testing missiles on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Israel Defense Forces announces resumption of ceasefire following strikes
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces indicated that a ceasefire was being resumed after the Jewish state, a key ally of the United States, executed strikes on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Photos as Hurricane Melissa makes landfall as Category 5 storm
item.description: "Don't bet against Melissa because you will lose," warned Jamaican Government Minister Desmond McKenzie.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation

item.title: Video: Hurricane Hunters inside Melissa's eye
item.description: The Hunters wrote on social media Tuesday that they were forced to turn back from another mission into the eye of Melissa due to "heavy turbulence.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, NewsNation
